events.originalText: Wildfires erupted across central Portugal, eventually causing the deaths of 66 people.
events.subtitle: June 2017 Portugal wildfires
events.headline: Wildfires in central Portugal claim 66 lives

events.originalText: A white supremacist committed a mass shooting at the Emanuel African Methodist Episcopal Church in Charleston, South Carolina, killing nine people during a prayer service.
events.subtitle: White supremacy
events.headline: White supremacist kills 9 in Charleston church shooting

events.originalText: Riots broke out in Saigon one day after the signing of the Joint Communiqué, an attempt to resolve the Buddhist crisis in South Vietnam.
events.subtitle: Ho Chi Minh City
events.headline: Riots erupt in Saigon after Joint Communiqué signing

events.originalText: Guatemalan Revolution: The Guatemalan Congress passed Decree 900, redistributing unused land greater than 224 acres (0.91 km2) in area to local peasants.
events.subtitle: Guatemalan Revolution
events.headline: Guatemalan Congress passes Decree 900 in Revolution

events.originalText: Second World War: RMS Lancastria was sunk by German aircraft near Saint-Nazaire, France, causing thousands of fatalities in Britain's worst maritime disaster.
events.subtitle: World War II
events.headline: RMS Lancastria sunk near Saint-Nazaire, France

events.originalText: Hundreds of Canadian soldiers rioted in Epsom, England, after one of their comrades was arrested, leading to the death of a British police officer.
events.subtitle: Epsom riot
events.headline: Canadian soldiers riot in Epsom, England

events.originalText: In Detroit, autoworkers for car manufacturer Studebaker went on strike in the American auto industry's first major strike action.
events.subtitle: Detroit
events.headline: Studebaker autoworkers strike in Detroit

events.originalText: Boxer Rebellion: Allied naval forces captured the Taku Forts from Qing China after a brief but bloody battle.
events.subtitle: Boxer Rebellion
events.headline: Allied forces capture Taku Forts in Boxer Rebellion

events.originalText: American Civil War: The Battle of Vienna, Virginia, took place, which involved one of the world's first military movements of troops by train.
events.subtitle: American Civil War
events.headline: Battle of Vienna, Virginia, involves troop movement by train

events.originalText: French Revolutionary Wars: Off the coast of Brittany, a Royal Navy squadron commanded by William Cornwallis (pictured) fended off a numerically superior French Navy fleet.
events.subtitle: French Revolutionary Wars
events.headline: Royal Navy squadron fends off French fleet off Brittany coast

events.originalText: American Revolutionary War: British forces took Bunker Hill outside of Boston, Massachusetts.
events.subtitle: American Revolutionary War
events.headline: British forces take Bunker Hill in American Revolutionary War

events.originalText: Mumtaz Mahal (pictured), wife of the Mughal emperor Shah Jahan, died in childbirth; Jahan spent the next seventeen years constructing her mausoleum, the Taj Mahal.
events.subtitle: Mumtaz Mahal
events.headline: Mumtaz Mahal dies in childbirth, Taj Mahal construction begins

events.originalText: Explorer Francis Drake landed in a region of present-day California, naming it New Albion and claiming it for England.
events.subtitle: Francis Drake
events.headline: Francis Drake claims New Albion in present-day California

events.originalText: Ottoman–Hungarian wars: Wallachian forces led by Vlad Dracula attacked an Ottoman camp at night in an unsuccessful attempt to assassinate Sultan Mehmed II.
events.subtitle: Ottoman–Hungarian wars
events.headline: Vlad Dracula attacks Ottoman camp in failed assassination attempt

events.originalText: The kingdoms of Denmark, Sweden, and Norway formed the Kalmar Union, a personal union under Eric of Pomerania.
events.subtitle: Kalmar Union
events.headline: Denmark, Sweden, and Norway form Kalmar Union under Eric of Pomerania

events.originalText: Pope Martin I was arrested in the Lateran Palace, Rome,  and taken to Constantinople.
events.subtitle: Pope Martin I
events.headline: Pope Martin I arrested and taken to Constantinople
